articles.author: Amruta Khandekar, Shristi A
articles.description: Wall Street's main indexes fell on Tuesday as investors waited for a slew of data, including the crucial jobs report, to gauge whether the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates by early next year.
articles.title: Wall St slips as focus shifts to jobs data

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: U.S. Supreme Court justices on Tuesday appeared hesitant to upend a tax on Americans who have invested in certain foreign corporations, as they pondered the meaning of "income" in a case that could undermine efforts by some Democratic lawmakers to impose a wealth tax on the very rich.
articles.title: US Supreme Court wary of upending tax on Americans' foreign earnings

articles.author: Nia Williams, Stephanie Kelly
articles.description: Canadian oil producers are bracing for further potential delays to the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion (TMX) that could cost them millions of dollars in lost revenues in coming months after they ramped up production ready to fill the expanded line, meant to unlock access to Asia.
articles.title: Focus: Canada oil firms face losses as booming supply runs into Trans Mountain delays

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. job openings dropped in October to the lowest level since early 2021, indicating that the labor market was easing as higher interest rates cool demand in the economy.
articles.title: US job openings in October lowest since 2021, well below forecasts

articles.author: Martin Coulter
articles.description: Amazon (AMZN.O) has told Britain's antitrust authority its rival Microsoft (MSFT.O) uses business practices that restrict customer choice in the cloud computing market, the second major company to criticise the U.S. tech giant's operations.
articles.title: Amazon latest to criticise Microsoft in UK cloud market probe

articles.author: Nate Raymond
articles.description: A federal judge considering the U.S. Justice Department's bid to block JetBlue Airways' proposed $3.8 billion acquisition of Spirit Airlines raised the possibility on Tuesday of letting the deal proceed if JetBlue divests more assets as the antitrust trial wrapped up.
articles.title: Trial over JetBlue's Spirit merger ends with US judge mulling options

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ratings agency Moody's on Tuesday cut its outlook on China's government credit ratings to negative from stable, citing lower medium-term economic growth and risks from a major correction in the country's vast property sector.
articles.title: Moody's cuts China credit outlook to negative, cites lower growth, property risks

articles.author: Humeyra Pamuk, Jonathan Saul, Maggie Fick
articles.description: Facing a soaring death toll from Israel's renewed offensive in southern Gaza, the Biden administration is trying to pressure its ally to minimize civilian deaths while stopping well short of the kind of measures that might force it to listen, such as threatening to restrict military aid.
articles.title: Despite Gaza death toll soaring, U.S. unlikely to rethink weapons supplies to Israel

articles.author: Susan Heavey
articles.description: Republican former U.S. Representative Liz Cheney, an outspoken critic of ex-President Donald Trump who co-chaired the congressional probe of the Jan. 6, 2021, attack on the Capitol, said she is weighing a third-party bid for the White House in 2024.
articles.title: Liz Cheney weighs third-party US presidential run, says Trump threatens democracy

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors trying Donald Trump on charges of trying to overturn his 2020 election defeat will seek to show evidence of the former president's claims about voter fraud in 2012 and 2016, according a court document filed on Tuesday.
articles.title: US aims to show Trump's history of vote fraud claims at 2020 election trial
